secret.translation[0].definitions[0].def: known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others
secret.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
The drugs were found in a secret compartment in Campbell’s suitcase.
The cookies are made to a secret recipe.
secret.translation[0].definitions[1].def: secret feelings, worries, or actions are ones that you do not want other people to know about
secret.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: His secret fear was that Jenny would leave him.
Did you know you had a secret admirer (=someone who is secretly in love with you)?
secret.translation[0].definitions[2].def: used to describe the behaviour of someone who is keeping their thoughts, intentions, or actions hidden from other people
secret.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: There was a secret smile on her face.
They’re being very secret about it.
secret.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: secret
known about by only a few people, who have agreed not to tell anyone else
a secret meeting place
The details of the proposal must remain secret.
confidential
used about information, especially in business or government, that is secret and not intended to be shown or told to other people
a highly confidential report
Employees’ personal details are treated as strictly confidential.
classified
used about information that the government has ordered to be kept secret from most people
He was accused of passing on classified information to the Russians in the 1950s.
sensitive
used about information that is kept secret because there would be problems if the wrong people knew it
A teenager managed to hack into sensitive US Air Force files.
covert
used about things that are done secretly, especially by a government or official organization
a CIA covert operation
undercover
used about things that are done secretly by the police in order to catch criminals or find out information
Detectives arrested the suspect after a five-day undercover operation.
underground
an underground organization or newspaper is one that operates or is produced secretly and opposes the government
Her father was a member of the underground resistance movement in France during World War II.
clandestine
secret and often illegal or immoral
clandestine meetings
his involvement in a clandestine operation to sell arms to Iran
a clandestine love affair
hush-hush
used about information or activities that are kept officially secret
He was put in charge of some hush-hush military project.
I’ve no idea what he does – it’s all very hush-hush.
secret.translation[1].definitions[0].def: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
secret.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (=I won’t tell anyone about it).
secret.translation[1].note_box[0].sectio: We have no secrets from each other.
You can tell Tom that I know his secret.
Shall I tell you a secret?
let somebody in on a secret
Frank let me in on the secret.
He was accused of revealing state secrets.
I had to be careful not to give away any secrets.
I trusted Alexander, so I decided to share my secret with him.
He was afraid that someone would discover his secret.
The event was supposed to be a big secret, but everyone knew about it.
You must promise me that this will be our little secret.
The recipe is a closely-guarded secret.
It was an open secret that he was having an affair.
I’m sure every family has a few dark secrets.
The exclusion of black people from the film industry is one of Hollywood’s dirty little secrets.
He had finally discovered Jo’s guilty secret.
She wasn’t confident enough to share her innermost secrets with him.
Their normally strong relationship is threatened when he has to reveal a family secret.
He was accused of passing on state secrets to a foreign power.
They must not betray their employer’s trust, for instance by giving away trade secrets.
He was sent to prison for five years in 1933 for selling military secrets to Germany.
secret.translation[2].definitions[0].def: something that is secret is only known about by a few people and kept hidden from other people, sometimes because it is illegal
secret.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The unexpected merger has triggered reports of a secret deal.
The judge has twice insisted that there must be a secret ballot (=a vote in which every individual voter can keep his or her vote a secret).
secret.translation[2].definitions[1].def: information about a company or its products which is known only to a few people in the company, and which must not be given to anyone not working for it
secret.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The company has labelled the underlying sales data a trade secret.
A law prohibits employees from divulging  (=telling other people) corporate secrets.
